src: The history of Ligao Tang can be traced back to 634 (the Tang Zhenguan Eighth Year). According to legend, the mother of Wei Zheng (a renowned official in Tang Dynasty) suffered from cough, so the imperial court often send imperial physicians to treat her and gave prescriptions to her. However, Wei's mother felt the medicines were too bitter to take, and she failed to take them on time, which leaded to the result that she cannot be cured in a long period. Due to this reason, Wei Zheng decided to make his own medicine, which was to combine almond, Chuanbei (bulbus fritillariae cirrhosae), tuckahoe, and Juhong (red tangerine peel) together, and then add the combination into pear syrup, and finally decoct the whole thing into paste.
tgt: 梨膏糖可追溯到唐贞观八年（公元634年），相传唐朝名臣魏征的母亲经常咳嗽气喘，故朝中常派太医给魏母诊治开出药方，但魏母嫌苦未能按时服用而久病不愈，于是魏征将杏仁，川贝、茯苓、桔红等加工后掺入梨膏内熬制成膏状供其母服用。
hyp: 利高汤的历史可以追溯到634年（唐贞观八年）。传说，唐朝著名官员魏征的母亲患有咳嗽，朝廷便常派御医前去治疗并给她开处方。然而，魏母觉得药太苦难以下咽，加之未能按时服用，致使长期未能痊愈。出于这个原因，魏征决定自制药方：他将杏仁、川贝（川贝母）、茯苓和橘红（红橘皮）混合在一起，再加入梨糖浆，最后将其煎煮成膏。

src: Luoyang bridge, also known as Wan'an bridge, is named for situating on the Luoyang river. Legend has it that in Tang dynasty, emperor Xuanzong of Tang disguised himself and went to the street to inspect people's lives. He stopped by a river in north-west hui'an county, Quanzhou, and claimed the scenery by the river was somewhat similar as what he saw in Luoyang. src: Every year, the festival of Sheri (Community Day) is held two times, one in spring and one in autumn. It was because ancient Chinese believed that "the prayer in spring can be rewarded in autumn". Shang Binghe, a famous scholar of I Ching at the turn of the Republic of China, described Sheri as "the oldest and the most prevailing festival in Chinese history". One of its legacy is the temples housing the Tudishen which are still common across China.

src: The Southern Song Dynasty (June 12, 1127-March 19, 1279) is the second era of the Song era. It is named the "Two Songs" along with the Northern Song Dynasty, forming the Song dynasty. src: As of December 2018, the only Traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) therapy approved by the National Medical Products Administration (NMPA) of China was herbal ''tangcao'' tablets (). A number of other TCM supplements are under clinical trial reviews, but have not yet met NMPA standards. TCM research efforts are primarily focused on lessening the side affects of highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) and protecting against opportunistic infections. Extracts of TCM medicines have served as bases for trials of antiviral therapies, including baicalin and Dantonic. A group of nine HIV/AIDS patients in 2017 were reported to have been functionally cured through TCM treatments, but these trials lacked controlled, regular observations.
tgt: 截至2018年12月，仅有唐草片一种中药通过了国家食品药品监督管理总局用以治疗HIV/AIDS的审批，另有益艾康胶囊、扶正排毒片、爱可扶正片、艾可清胶囊、艾灵颗粒、中研II号、扶正抗毒胶囊、康爱保生胶囊等一批药物临床在试，尚不能达到食品药品监督管理总局批准要求[145]。中医药治疗主要集中在协助HAART治疗减少副作用，以及防治艾滋病常见机会性感染，通过有《艾滋病中医诊疗指南》《艾滋病常见病证辨证施治技术指导原则》等一批技术规范文件[145]。

src: The Piper kawakamii Hayata, also known as the Kawakamii Pepper, belongs to the Piperaceae, Piper. It is a native endemic species in Taiwan. The plant is mainly distributed in the Hengchun Peninsula. It was collected by Takiya Kawakami at the Kuraru Community (currently known as the Kenting National Park), on July 2, 1906. In 1911, the plant was published by Bunzo Hayata as a new species. The type specimen of this plant is being preserved in the Botanical Gardens, Graduate School of Science, the University of Tokyo, Japan [註 1]and the Herbarium of Taiwan Forest Research Institute [註 2].

src: In ancient times, the main way of food acquisition in China changed from fishing, hunting and animal husbandry to agriculture. src: The history of Ligao Tang can be traced back to 634 (the Tang Zhenguan Eighth Year). According to legend, the mother of Wei Zheng (a renowned official in Tang Dynasty) suffered from cough, so the imperial court often send imperial physicians to treat her and gave prescriptions to her. However, Wei's mother felt the medicines were too bitter to take, and she failed to take them on time, which leaded to the result that she cannot be cured in a long period. Due to this reason, Wei Zheng decided to make his own medicine, which was to combine almond, Chuanbei (bulbus fritillariae cirrhosae), tuckahoe, and Juhong (red tangerine peel) together, and then add the combination into pear syrup, and finally decoct the whole thing into paste.

hyp: 理膏汤的历史可追溯到634年（唐贞观八年）。据传说，唐代著名官员魏征的母亲曾患咳嗽，故宫廷常派御医前来医治并开具药方。然而，魏母觉得药物实在太苦，未能及时服用，致使长期无法痊愈。基于这一原因，魏征决定自制药方，即将杏仁、川贝（川贝母）、茯苓和橘红（红橘皮）混合，再加入梨膏，最后将混合物煎煮成膏。

src: Every year, the festival of Sheri (Community Day) is held two times, one in spring and one in autumn. It was because ancient Chinese believed that "the prayer in spring can be rewarded in autumn". Shang Binghe, a famous scholar of I Ching at the turn of the Republic of China, described Sheri as "the oldest and the most prevailing festival in Chinese history". One of its legacy is the temples housing the Tudishen which are still common across China.
tgt: 春社一般与“秋社”合称为“社日”，历来有“春祈秋报”的说法:540。清末民初着名易学家尚秉和称，社日“在中国历史上，可谓最古最普遍之佳节。”:422现今各地遍存的土地庙即是社日祭社时的遗存。
hyp: 每年，社日（社区日）节举办两次，一次在春季，一次在秋季。这源于古人信仰“春祈秋报”。民国初期著名的易学家尚秉和曾将社日形容为“中华历史上最古老、流行至今的节日”。其遗留下来的一个重要成果就是供奉土地神的庙宇，如今在中国各地依旧随处可见。

src: The Southern Song Dynasty (June 12, 1127-March 19, 1279) is the second era of the Song era. It is named the "Two Songs" along with the Northern Song Dynasty, forming the Song dynasty. After the Northern Song Dynasty ended with the invasion and occupation of Kaifeng by the Jin people. On June 12, 1127, the 9th son of Emperor Huizong of Song, Zhao Kingan, fled to Nanjing's Yingtian (now Shangqiu, Henan) to reign as Emperor Gaozong of Song. As in Wuxing, Song Dynasty was "fire", so the year was named Jianyan(建炎), literally meaning "building fire".
tgt: 南宋（1127年6月12日－1279年3月19日）是宋朝的其中一个时期，与北宋合称「两宋」。北宋以开封被金人攻入及佔领而结束，1127年6月12日，宋徽宗第九子康王赵构南逃至南京应天府（今河南商丘）即位，是为宋高宗，改元建炎。因宋朝的五行德运为「火」，改元「建炎」意味着重建王朝的火德。

src: As of December 2018, the only Traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) therapy approved by the National Medical Products Administration (NMPA) of China was herbal ''tangcao'' tablets (). A number of other TCM supplements are under clinical trial reviews, but have not yet met NMPA standards. TCM research efforts are primarily focused on lessening the side affects of highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) and protecting against opportunistic infections. Extracts of TCM medicines have served as bases for trials of antiviral therapies, including baicalin and Dantonic. A group of nine HIV/AIDS patients in 2017 were reported to have been functionally cured through TCM treatments, but these trials lacked controlled, regular observations.
tgt: 截至2018年12月，仅有唐草片一种中药通过了国家食品药品监督管理总局用以治疗HIV/AIDS的审批，另有益艾康胶囊、扶正排毒片、爱可扶正片、艾可清胶囊、艾灵颗粒、中研II号、扶正抗毒胶囊、康爱保生胶囊等一批药物临床在试，尚不能达到食品药品监督管理总局批准要求[145]。中医药治疗主要集中在协助HAART治疗减少副作用，以及防治艾滋病常见机会性感染，通过有《艾滋病中医诊疗指南》《艾滋病常见病证辨证施治技术指导原则》等一批技术规范文件[145]。
hyp: 截至2018年12月，经中国国家药品监督管理局（NMPA）批准的唯一一种传统中医药疗法是草药“汤草”片。许多其他中医药保健品正处于临床试验审查阶段，但尚未达到NMPA的标准。中医药研究工作主要集中在减少高效抗逆转录病毒疗法（HAART）的副作用以及防治机会性感染。中药提取物已成为抗病毒疗法试验的基础，其中包括黄芩苷和丹托尼克。2017年有报道显示，一组由9名HIV/AIDS患者组成的群体通过中医药治疗实现了功能性治愈，但这些试验缺乏对照和定期观察。

src: After the reunification, Zhou was re-elected for many terms in Yuen Long District Council. He won again in the Tianrui Constituency with a 84% vote in the 1999 Hong Kong local elections. After Deng Zhaotang retired, Zhou Zhou, who worked well in the region, was favored by Lau wong-fat and invited by Liu to join the Liberal Party. src: The Piper kawakamii Hayata, also known as the Kawakamii Pepper, belongs to the Piperaceae, Piper. It is a native endemic species in Taiwan. The type specimen of this plant is being preserved in the Botanical Gardens, Graduate School of Science, the University of Tokyo, Japan [註 1]and the Herbarium of Taiwan Forest Research Institute [註 2].

src: In ancient times, the main way of food acquisition in China changed from fishing, hunting and animal husbandry to agriculture. Therefore, people came to realize the importance of the land and began to worship it The land was personalized and then the idea of "deity of the land" came into existence The rulers as well as the people at that period began to offer sacrifices to the deity The descriptions of the ceremony could be found in oracle bone scripts Gradually, this customs of sacrifice developed into what people later called Chunshe

src: The history of Ligao Tang can be traced back to 634 (the Tang Zhenguan Eighth Year). According to legend, the mother of Wei Zheng (a renowned official in Tang Dynasty) suffered from cough, so the imperial court often send imperial physicians to treat her and gave prescriptions to her. However, Wei's mother felt the medicines were too bitter to take, and she failed to take them on time, which leaded to the result that she cannot be cured in a long period. Due to this reason, Wei Zheng decided to make his own medicine, which was to combine almond, Chuanbei (bulbus fritillariae cirrhosae), tuckahoe, and Juhong (red tangerine peel) together, and then add the combination into pear syrup, and finally decoct the whole thing into paste.
tgt: 梨膏糖可追溯到唐贞观八年（公元634年），相传唐朝名臣魏征的母亲经常咳嗽气喘，故朝中常派太医给魏母诊治开出药方，但魏母嫌苦未能按时服用而久病不愈，于是魏征将杏仁，川贝、茯苓、桔红等加工后掺入梨膏内熬制成膏状供其母服用。
hyp: 里高汤的历史可以追溯到634年（唐贞观八年）。传说，唐代著名官员魏征的母亲患有咳嗽，因此朝廷经常派御医为她诊治，并给她开处方。但魏征的母亲觉得这些药物太苦，因而未能按时服用，导致长期未能痊愈。正因为如此，魏征决定自制药物，将杏仁、川贝（川贝母）、茯苓和橘红（红橘皮）混合在一起，再加入梨膏，最后将整合物煎煮成膏。

src: Luoyang bridge, also known as Wan'an bridge, is named for situating on the Luoyang river. Legend has it that in Tang dynasty, emperor Xuanzong of Tang disguised himself and went to the street to inspect people's lives. He stopped by a river in north-west hui'an county, Quanzhou, and claimed the scenery by the river was somewhat similar as what he saw in Luoyang. Therefore the river is called Luoyang river ever since.

src: The Eastern Zhejiang Canal deeply influences many cities and towns on both its sides. src: Every year, the festival of Sheri (Community Day) is held two times, one in spring and one in autumn. It was because ancient Chinese believed that "the prayer in spring can be rewarded in autumn". Shang Binghe, a famous scholar of I Ching at the turn of the Republic of China, described Sheri as "the oldest and the most prevailing festival in Chinese history". One of its legacy is the temples housing the Tudishen which are still common across China.

src: The Southern Song Dynasty (June 12, 1127-March 19, 1279) is the second era of the Song era. It is named the "Two Songs" along with the Northern Song Dynasty, forming the Song dynasty. src: As of December 2018, the only Traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) therapy approved by the National Medical Products Administration (NMPA) of China was herbal ''tangcao'' tablets (). A number of other TCM supplements are under clinical trial reviews, but have not yet met NMPA standards. TCM research efforts are primarily focused on lessening the side affects of highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) and protecting against opportunistic infections. Extracts of TCM medicines have served as bases for trials of antiviral therapies, including baicalin and Dantonic. A group of nine HIV/AIDS patients in 2017 were reported to have been functionally cured through TCM treatments, but these trials lacked controlled, regular observations.
tgt: 截至2018年12月，仅有唐草片一种中药通过了国家食品药品监督管理总局用以治疗HIV/AIDS的审批，另有益艾康胶囊、扶正排毒片、爱可扶正片、艾可清胶囊、艾灵颗粒、中研II号、扶正抗毒胶囊、康爱保生胶囊等一批药物临床在试，尚不能达到食品药品监督管理总局批准要求[145]。中医药治疗主要集中在协助HAART治疗减少副作用，以及防治艾滋病常见机会性感染，通过有《艾滋病中医诊疗指南》《艾滋病常见病证辨证施治技术指导原则》等一批技术规范文件[145]。

src: The Piper kawakamii Hayata, also known as the Kawakamii Pepper, belongs to the Piperaceae, Piper. It is a native endemic species in Taiwan. The plant is mainly distributed in the Hengchun Peninsula. It was collected by Takiya Kawakami at the Kuraru Community (currently known as the Kenting National Park), on July 2, 1906. In 1911, the plant was published by Bunzo Hayata as a new species. The type specimen of this plant is being preserved in the Botanical Gardens, Graduate School of Science, the University of Tokyo, Japan [註 1]and the Herbarium of Taiwan Forest Research Institute [註 2].

src: Endemic to Taiwan, this is one of the narrowly distributed plants of the Sedum genus that are distributed in low-altitude areas of the island, along with S. uniflorum Hook. & Arn., Sedum drymarioides Hance, S. tarokoense H.
